data.name: Delivery Disaster
data.description:
Hi, we need your help to get the post out to the right addresses. 

The postcodes have been scrambled and we need to unsrcamble them to uncover a valid UK postcode. 

Examples of scrambled postcodes: 

```E6 5JG``` has become ```E-.,;/6''5JG```.
```N9 6JJ``` has become ```N);/,.;'9\][';6(-==[]''\J;'/.J```
```S1 5GP``` has become ```S&%$&1$@£$@!0%£ 5{}|?G£$!@P^£$!^&```

You need to match the following pattern of letter number space number letter letter. Postcodes can only begin with S, W, E, or N. Postcodes can only end with a number (0-9) followed by two letters which are uppercase. 

Task 

Your task is given a string, to determine if it contains a valid UK postcode or not. If the string contains a valid postcode return the postcode, else return ```"Not a Post Code" ```
